translated: Sutra of the Names and Divine Spells of Five Thousand and Five Hundred Buddhas, for Eliminating Obstacles and Destroying Sins
Scroll 1
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master JÃ±Änagupta of Northern India during the Great Sui Dynasty
Thus have I heard:
At one time, the BhagavÄn was dwelling in RÄjagá¹›ha on Gá¹›dhrakÅ«á¹­a Mountain, together with a great assembly of 1,250 bhiká¹£us;
and also with a congregation of 12,000 bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, with Ajita Bodhisattva at the head.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to Maitreya Bodhisattva:
Maitreya!
To the east of this buddha-land, there are buddha-lands as numerous as the dust particles in ten ineffable buddha-lands, a hundred thousand koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas in number.

Beyond those buddha-lands, there is a buddha-land called 'World of the Lord of Liberation.' Within that world, there is a buddha named 'TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyaksaá¹ƒbuddha of the King of Unobstructed Adornments of the Dharma Realm, Born from the Power of Vows, Adorned with the Light of Countless Suns and Moons, with the Body of the Light of Lapis Lazuli and the Fragrance of the Supreme Fragrance, Having Perfected the Worship of the Flower of the Pure Merit of Space,' who is presently traveling the path according to his mind's desires, freely expounding the Dharma wherever he goes.

If good men and good women commit the four grave offenses, the weight of their crimes would be as if the land of JambudvÄ«pa were turned into fine dust, with each particle of dust forming an eon. The number of eons of offenses that such people have would be completely eradicated by calling the name of that buddha and paying homage once.
How much more so for those who uphold, recite, and remember it day and night without forgetting, the merit of these people is inconceivable.

In that world there is a bodhisattva named Incomparable Unobstructed King, to whom the TathÄgata has given a prediction that he will attain Buddhahood and be called ÅšarÄ«ra Sun and Moon Light Flame Jewel Lotus Firm as Vajra Body Vairocana Unobstructed Eye Completely Illuminating the Ten Directions Emitting Light Illuminating All Buddha Lands Appearance King TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha, Well-Gone, Knower of the World, Supreme Trainer to be Tamed, Teacher of Gods and Men, Buddha, World-Honored One.
However, in the east there is another Buddha, named All Adornments and Purity Light TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
One should also chant the name of that Buddha, and revere and respect him.
In the south there is a buddha named Eloquence-Adorned TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, chant his name, and think of his name in your mind.
In the west there is a buddha named Stainless Moon-Mark-King-Renown TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, chant his name, and think of his name in your mind.
In the north there is a buddha named Flower-Adorned-Radiant TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, chant his name, and think of his name in your mind.
In the southeast there is a buddha named Lamp-Maker TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, and also chant his name, and also mentally recall the name of that buddha.
In the southwest there is a buddha named Jewel-Superior-Appearance-Renown TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, and also chant his name, and also mentally recall the name of that buddha.
In the northwest there is a buddha named Fearless Contemplation TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, and also chant his name, and also mentally recall the name of that buddha.
In the northeast there is a buddha named Fearless, Without Timidity, with Hair Standing on End, the TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, and also chant his name, and also mentally recall the name of that buddha.
Below there is a buddha named Lion's Mane Root TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, and also chant his name, and also mentally recall the name of that buddha.
Above there is a buddha named Golden Light King's Resemblance TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
You should also chant the name of that buddha, cultivate reverence, and also chant his name, and also mentally recall the name of that buddha.
At that time, the Buddha told Maitreya:
If there are sons and daughters of good family with right faith, when they sincerely recite the names of these
twelve buddhas, for ten days they should cultivate repentance for all their
sins, rejoice in all the merits of sentient beings, request all the
buddhas to remain in the world for a long time, and dedicate the roots of goodness to the dharma realm. At that time, they will be able to extinguish
all their sins, attain the purification of all karmic hindrances, and immediately attain the adornment of all buddha lands, attain fearlessness, and also attain the adornment of the body,

attain the retinue of bodhisattvas surrounding them, attain immeasurable dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, attain immeasurable samÄdhis, attain the adornment of buddha lands as one wishes, and also attain immeasurable good and wise advisors, and quickly attain the accomplishment of what was explained above.
Not increasing or decreasing, they practice anuttara-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi in the midst of afflictions
, and attain the reward of being upright and delightful, as well as abundant wealth and treasures, always being born in a
great and noble family, with a perfect physical appearance, and also attaining a well-harmonious retinue surrounding them.
At that time, the World-Honored One, wishing to restate this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
If there are good men or good women,
who uphold the names of these Buddhas, in life after life,
they will be loved and respected by others, with great radiance and power,
being honored by people in their place of birth, and later attaining Buddhahood.
